programme.title: Manchester City vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Manchester City have won five of their last eight Premier League matches against Manchester United, though they failed to win either game last season for the first time since 2020-21. Manchester United have inflicted 25% of Pep Guardiola’s total home Premier League defeats as Man City manager, with the Red Devils winning four times there against the Spaniard. They are looking for consecutive wins at the Etihad for the first time since March 2021.

programme.title: Arsenal vs. Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: In all competitions, Arsenal have won their last six home games against Nottingham Forest by an aggregate score of 19-2. The Gunners are unbeaten in 14 games on home soil against Forest since a 3-1 defeat back in March 1989. Nottingham Forest have won just two out of 16 Premier League matches against Arsenal and both wins came at the City Ground, in 1996-97 and 2022-23.

programme.title: Burnley vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Burnley have lost 14 of their 18 Premier League matches against Liverpool, including each of their last five in a row since a 1-0 win at Anfield in January 2021. Liverpool have won eight of their nine away Premier League matches at Turf Moor against Burnley, winning the last six in a row. The Reds have won seven away top-flight games in a row against three teams previously: West Brom, Norwich and Crystal Palace.

programme.title: Liverpool vs. Everton - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Liverpool have lost just one of their last 28 home games against Everton in all competitions, winning each of their last four in a row since a 0-2 defeat in February 2021. Only from February 1933 to January 1937 have the Reds ever won five straight home matches against the Toffees. Everton have won just two of their last 29 Premier League Merseyside derbies against Liverpool and have failed to score in five of their last seven.

programme.title: Manchester United vs. Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Manchester United are unbeaten in their last 12 Premier League home games against Chelsea since a 0-1 defeat in May 2013. Indeed, Chelsea’s win rate of 18% at Old Trafford in the Premier League is their lowest away to any side they have visited 10+ times in the competition. After their 1-0 win in May, Chelsea are looking for successive league victories over Manchester United for the first time since winning three in a row from November 2009 to March 2011 under Carlo Ancelotti. The Blues’ two wins in their last three league games versus the Red Devils are as many as their previous 17 beforehand.

programme.title: Club Brugge vs Monaco - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD1
programme.desc: Club Brugge have played Monaco four times before in major European competition, suffering a 6-2 aggregate defeat at the Round of 16 stage of the 1988-89 European Cup before going unbeaten against them during the 2018-19 UEFA Champions League group stage. Monaco have won just one of their four away games across major European competition against Belgian sides, a 1-0 victory over K. Lierse SK during the 1997-98 UEFA Champions League group stage.

programme.title: Manchester City vs Napoli - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD1
programme.desc: All four of the previous meetings between Manchester City and Napoli in Europe have been in the group stage of the UEFA Champions League. The Citizens went winless in 2011-12, before winning home and away against them in 2017-18. Napoli have never won away to an English side in any European competition, losing at least once against six of the seven different teams they have faced, with Leicester being the only exception.

Qualifying - FIA Formula 2 Championship - Baku Round -2025
programme.desc: A tow-chess match: hook the slipstream on the 2.2 km straight yet keep clear air through the tight middle sector. Millimetres from walls decide tenths. Bank a safe lap, then one all-in push for the 2-point pole that sets the Feature grid and shapes the reversed top-10 for the Sprint. Track evolution can transform the final minutes.

programme.title: Practice 2 - F1 Qatar Airways Azerbaijan Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: The most representative 60-minute session for race prep. Squads refine power-unit modes, test fuel-corrected long runs, and tune drag vs. downforce for the 6.003 km layout. Focus: brake stability into Turn 1, traction through the infield, and ERS deployment for overtakes. Data here frames tyre choice and pit windows for Sunday.

programme.title: Main Race - F1 Pirelli Gran Premio DItalia - 2025 - Italian GP
programme.desc: High-speed chess at Monza. Slipstream battles, DRS trains and braking duels define the Italian GP, while tire wear and pit windows decide track position. Teams balance straight-line pace with stability over kerbs; drivers manage temps and fuel to attack late. A classic showdown in front of the Tifosi.

programme.title: Practice 1 - F1 Qatar Airways Azerbaijan Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: Opening 60-minute run to baseline the car for Baku’s bumps and long straights. Teams map aero levels, ride heights, brake cooling, and tyre temps, then log long-run data to understand degradation. Early laps build confidence near the walls; speed-trap checks on the 2.2 km straight guide wing trim for the rest of the weekend.

Practice 3 - F1 Qatar Airways Azerbaijan Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: Final 60 minutes before qualifying. Low-fuel laps chase peak grip as track evolution ramps up. Millimetres from the barriers decide tenths; a clean read here sets confidence for Q1–Q3.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Sprint Race - FIA Formula 2 Championship - Baku Round -2025
programme.desc: Reverse-grid Sprint magnifies race-craft—no mandatory stop. Launch, tyre warm-up and ERS timing into Turn 1 set early gains. Survival through Safety Cars can catapult a P8–P10 starter into podium contention. With 10 points for the win, clean restarts and late-race patience are vital on a circuit that punishes tiny errors.

programme.title: Main Race Qualifying - F1 Qatar Airways Azerbaijan Grand Prix - 2025
programme.desc: Three-phase knockout on a slipstream-sensitive circuit. Timing the tow can swing rows on the grid, but precision through the castle complex and a tidy final sector are non-negotiable. Track evolution is high; banker laps matter. Pole is often decided by tenths, with teamwork and traffic management crucial to clear air.

programme.title: Burnley vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Both sides have scored in six of the last seven league meetings between Burnley and Nottingham Forest, with the only exception a 1-0 win for the Clarets in the Championship in February 2016. After their 2-1 win at Turf Moor on the final day of the 2023-24 season, Nottingham Forest could win back-to-back league meetings against Burnley for the first time since September 2003, and first time in the top-flight since March 1967. The Tricky Trees have never previously won back-to-back league visits to Burnley, with this their 52nd trip.

programme.title: DTM Show 2025-Red Bull Ring
Brest vs Nice - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Brest have won only one of their last nine matches against Nice in Ligue 1, a 1-0 success on April 16, 2023 at Francis-Le Ble. It was also the last time that the Bretons managed to score a goal against Les Aiglons in the top-flight. There have been 1.1 goals per game between Brest and Nice at Francis-Le Ble in Ligue 1 in the 21st century, the lowest average between two current top-flight teams in the same venue over that period.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: Liverpool vs Everton - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Liverpool have lost just one of their last 28 home games against Everton in all competitions, winning each of their last four in a row since a 0-2 defeat in February 2021. Only from February 1933 to January 1937 have the Reds ever won five straight home matches against the Toffees. Everton have won just two of their last 29 Premier League Merseyside derbies against Liverpool and have failed to score in five of their last seven.

programme.title: Brighton and Hove Albion vs Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Brighton completed a Premier League double over Tottenham Hotspur last season – the only time they have ever won back-to-back league meetings with Spurs. Tottenham Hotspur have lost away to Brighton in both of the last two league seasons but have never before lost three successive visits.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Chelsea - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Manchester United are unbeaten in their last 12 Premier League home games against Chelsea since a 0-1 defeat in May 2013. Indeed, Chelsea’s win rate of 18% at Old Trafford in the Premier League is their lowest away to any side they have visited 10+ times in the competition. After their 1-0 win in May, Chelsea are looking for successive league victories over Manchester United for the first time since winning three in a row from November 2009 to March 2011 under Carlo Ancelotti. The Blues’ two wins in their last three league games versus the Red Devils are as many as their previous 17 beforehand.

programme.title: Fulham vs Brentford - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 5
programme.desc: Fulham completed a Premier League double over Brentford last season and are looking to win three league games in a row over the Bees for the second time, after winning their first three clashes from 1928 to 1929. Brentford have lost two of their three Premier League visits to Craven Cottage, more than their previous 15 league trips to Fulham beforehand, while they could lose twice in a row at Fulham in the league for the first time since January 1954.
